text: Here are instructions

for how to delete your
Google search history.
Keep in mind, this will delete
the search history off of your devices,
but data about your search history
will still be maintained by Google itself.
In any browser, go to Google.com.
In the upper right-hand corner,
log in to your Google account.
Once signed in, click the Google Apps icon

in the upper right corner
of the Google homepage.
In the drop-down menu, click "Account."

Click "Data & personalization"
from the sidebar menu
on the left side of the screen.
Locate the "Activity controls" section
and click "Manage your activity controls."
In the "Web & App Activity" section,
click "Manage activity."
To delete search activity one by one,
click the X next to each listing.

To delete multiple or all
search history at once,
click the "Delete" button
located underneath the search bar.
In the pop-up,

you can choose what
content you want to delete.

You can also set up
automatic deletions here.

Open up your mobile browser
and go to Google.com.
In the upper right-hand corner,
log in to your Google account.
Once signed in,
tap the three horizontal lines
at the top left of the Google homepage.
Tap "Your data in Search."

Scroll down to the "Delete
your Search activity" section.
Tap either "Delete last hour" or
"Delete all Search activity."
In the window that pops up, tap "Delete."
